mods.abstract: Gateway of Ptolemy III, Euergetes I at Karnak, East Thebes (Ptolemaic Period); monumental gateway heavily inscribed with six rows of deities, kings, and hieroglyphs supporting lintel adorned with the winged sun disk, Egyptian man stands before shadows in between gateway; ruins of processional statues and palm trees (background); "Edition Photoglob 5447. Karnak Pylône d'Eugertes" in white along bottom of print. (Number on object is 18/655).

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
